column4: Hi, I need help to install dual-boot of ubuntu 10.04 with windows 7 with windows 7 installed first, i have 3 partitions made by widows 7 partitioner and i would like to use the last one
Is that last partition ext4 or 3?
not sure but i guess ext4
You're gonna need a swap partition as well.  so add that and when you're installing tell choose manual and tell Ubuntu to use that last partition as /
the partition i want to use is sda4
Great.  Then you have 4 primary partitions?
yep it shows sda1,2,3,4 sda2 has windows 7
maybe i can resize the last partition and take out 3-4 GB Space for my swap space?

You could also create a big chunk of empty space on the drive (in the place where you would want a partition) and tell Ubuntu "use the largest continuous free space" and it'll do all the partitioning for you.
how to create that big chunk of empty space? :P
by deleting partitions.  it looks grey and is called "unallocated" in gparted
Really it's you who is trusting me :)
Technically this is Ubuntu support not windows support.  Don't expect us to know the windows partitioner.
